intro: Gynotroches dryptopetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gynotroches, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant has a short stem and produces white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on alpine flora adaptation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
